{% raw %}
{% endraw %}

Imports

{% raw %} 
from gensim.models import Word2Vec
{% endraw %}

Pre-processing

{% raw %} 
from socemb.read_data import *
{% endraw %} {% raw %} 
fpaths = get_fpaths('Anglo-Saxon', source='local')
{% endraw %} {% raw %} 
df = read_comments(fpaths)
{% endraw %} {% raw %} 
docs = df['body']
{% endraw %} {% raw %} 
docs = docs.dropna()
{% endraw %} {% raw %} 
docs = docs.str.lower()
{% endraw %} {% raw %} 
docs = docs.str.split()
{% endraw %} {% raw %}

{% endraw %} {% raw %} 
len(docs)

138928
{% endraw %} {% raw %} 
sents =[
    ['I', 'like', 'playing', 'basketball', 'and', 'tennis'],
    ['You', 'like', 'reading', 'and', 'writing']
]
{% endraw %} {% raw %}

class Corpus[source]

Corpus(docs)

An iterator that yields sentences (lists of str).

{% endraw %} {% raw %}
{% endraw %} {% raw %} 
corpus = Corpus(docs)
{% endraw %}

Train embeddings

{% raw %} 
%%time
model = Word2Vec(
    corpus, 
    min_count=10,
    size=100,
    workers=3, 
    window=3
)
{% endraw %} {% raw %} 
model.wv['basketball'].shape

(50,)
{% endraw %}

Evaluate embeddings

{% raw %} 
for index, word in enumerate(model.wv.index2word):
    if index == 10:
        break
    print(f"word #{index}/{len(model.wv.index2word)} is {word}")

word #0/625086 is the
word #1/625086 is of
word #2/625086 is and
word #3/625086 is to
word #4/625086 is a
word #5/625086 is in
word #6/625086 is is
word #7/625086 is that
word #8/625086 is i
word #9/625086 is as
{% endraw %} {% raw %} 
model.wv.similarity('basketball', 'tennis')

0.87182456
{% endraw %} {% raw %} 
model.wv.similarity('basketball', 'i')

0.5944799
{% endraw %} {% raw %} 
model.wv.most_similar('basketball')[:10]

[('baseball', 0.9226516485214233),
